ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic accounting concepts, greater familiarity with financial statements.
Great basics overview of financial concepts. Going into the course, I didn't have any background in anything finance related. I now feel comfortable with basic concepts and discussing these concepts.
Basic accounting knowledge
The course provided me with the basic, foundational knowledge needed to engage in discussions on finance.

This course provided a valuable foundation for my future coursework in the Business and the Environment specialization. I learned about a wide variety of terms and financial analysis skills that will be critical for my success in this field.
Basic knowledge of financial terminology and methodologies. Practice doing basic financial analysis in excel.
Financial concepts
Basic accounting and financial analysis skills.
financial terms and basic financial concept analysis
How to analyze the main financial statements and discount cash flows.
Very, very basic understanding of financial concepts. I essentially now know more of the questions Ill need to ask if I need to do anything related to finance.
basic financial literacy and understanding of key terms methods
Introduction into reading financial statements

Understanding of financial concepts as they apply to the business/for profit space Much greater familiarity with finance/accounting lingo Cleared the air on previously confusing concepts in accounting Reading and interpreting balance sheets, income statements and cash flow statements and knowing the difference between them Assessing company performance and investor risk using financial measures and tools

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: They aligned well. We actually covered far more than I expected.
very well
I thought wed get a little more background information and context on finance, but it was mostly hands on work
It aligned perfectly; it was an introductory-level course exposing students to basic concepts.
The knowledge, skills, and insights I gained from this class exceeded my expectations.
Exceeded expectations

The brevity of the course made it challenging to work on many examples, which I had been expecting to do. I didn't really feel like I had actually gained tangible skills by the end of the class because we were moving at such a fast pace, but rather just gained the resources to refer to later.

During shopping period, it said the course was intended for financial concepts working in non-government. But actually, the course was business and profit focused financial concepts. So, the class did not align with my expectations.
I wish it had been clearer, more engaging, and with a little bit more guidance and explanation.
The course aligned with my expectations.
Very well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Maureen is clearly extremely knowledgeable Weaknesses: Seems like a full-semester course that's been squeezed into 6 weeks; pace is so fast that I began to get lost towards the end; I'm not sure why it's billed as "for Environmental Managers" because nothing about it was especially environmentally oriented, other than the fact that the hypothetical companies discussed were related to aquaculture and energy efficiency.
it was a great course - moved quickly, but good.
The course is structured well and I liked the repetition of concepts
Strength: Lectures were engaging. Weakness: nothing I can think of.

I appreciated the substantial amount of material that was covered in just six weeks. However, it would have been helpful to spend more time on each topic and to have more in-class opportunities to practice the skills we learned.
Strengths: This course requires little effort and does expose you to some basics of financial analysis.
course moves too fast.
Great course

The resources provided in the class seem very helpful, but it was challenging to really apply the concepts in a way that felt like I was actually learning them. Is it possible to make this class longer? The format of the class (lecture and in class exercises) is good but it would be helpful to have more time overall.
In class exercise are somewhat helpful. It could be improved giving more references and extra reading so as to be helpful for homework.

The class felt overwhelming and a bit hectic. Things moved really quickly and I never quite felt like I could catch up or really grasp the information. A list of terms, definitions, and equations would have been very, very helpful. The Wednesday 6-8 time slot was very challenging, especially in an underfilled large lecture hall. Its the sleepiest time of the week....

The course fulfilled its promise of providing knowledge of basic financial concepts, but I think it might be valuable to move through the material a little more slowly. There didn't seem to be enough time to think about one thing before moving on to the next topic.

I did not like doing the in class exercises. I felt that I did not have enough time to adequately understand and review the information before being expected to an an exercise. This portion of the class was wasted time for me.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: Make sure you look back over the notes Maureen provides before starting the homework (and maybe even before attending class). The lectures are so fast-paced that you may need to go over the concepts several times.
If you need to learn the basics of financial concepts, take this class.
Great for an intro, but I doubt I will retain any of the skills I learned
If a student is considering learning about financial concepts, this is a good place to start to decide whether or not they should further pursue this path.
The course has a very low time/effort investment, so if you want to be exposed to some financial basics it may be worth it.
Interesting course
This class is suitable for students who are seeking to pursue business focused environmental studies and thinking to take financial classes in the coming semesters.
Good intro class on financial fundamentals. The basics of accounting are covered, which are necessary skills for anyone working in the for-profit sector.
Dont. You can get a good background in financial concepts for free online. (If they change the course format, professor, or even timing of the course, it may be better.)
Definitely read the syllabus, and dont commit before attending the first class.

An excellent class for students wanting an introduction to financial concepts going beyond income and expenses. Includes weekly, but not very time-consuming assignments. Great for anyone not wanting to dive into a full accounting course but would like some appreciation of some basic accounting lingo and knowledge.
